When you first spotted Kamui, you noticed that, instead of wearing his traditional loincloth, he was sporting his blue swim trunks.

You remember that you were the one who helped him pick out the swimwear. The canine transient preferred to swim nude, but despite many of Tokyo’s beaches becoming clothing-optional after this world became a hub for multiple different Earths, given how prudish some people can be, you figured it would be best if the wolf wore something.

You managed to find an alternative though, as the chosen trunks were made out of an elastic material, contouring to his powerful leg muscles and large package while also giving him freedom of movement.

From wearing them, you could only assume where he was heading.

“How about we go to the beach?” you suggested.

The wolf god looked puzzled, and rightfully so. “My hero, is... is that a wise decision? Given the circumstances, our top priority is your health and well-being. We should take you somewhere safe and inform your guild members of the situation.”

Kamui was right. That was the logical thing to do... however, the thought of seeing his gigantic, chiseled physique completely wet and glistening was enough to make your mouth water, and a chance you were willing to take.

“We can do all that later. I may be small, but other than that, I’m totally fine! Besides, given what you’re wearing, you must’ve been ready to go for a swim, and I don’t want you to cancel your plans because of my problems.”

The wolf looked at you with his normal, glare-like look, but you could see a tinge of compassion in those golden eyes.

“My hero, your problems are my problems as well. I have vigorously trained both body and soul to be your protector, to be your sword and sheath. None of your problems could ever inconvenience me.”

That dedication was one of the reasons why you were attracted to the wolf. It was overbearing at times, but he always had the best of intentions, and that’s what mattered.

Although, you loved his body as well... and the mental image of his furry frame soaked from head-to-toe was something you couldn’t shake.

“I’ll be fine! Like you said, I have my ‘sword and sheath’ to look after me. If something were to happen, you’re the best fighter I know and there is no one else I would rather have my back, plus you have your sacred artifacts if things really go south. Trust me... we’re good.”

Despite your reassurance, Kamui couldn’t help but worry, some concern noticeably in his eyes.

“What if you fell off? You could be eaten by a bug, or splatter into a car’s windshield, or break every bone in your body as you crash into the earth, never to be seen or heard from again... You have been fortunate enough already! Had I not heard your voice, I could have easily trampled you underfoot without even noticing! The thought of my hero dying so unceremoniously... I cannot have that! I will never-”

“Kamui!”

With that barely audible yell of his name, Kamui snapped out of his thought process and focused solely on you and what you had to say.

“I have made up my mind. I appreciate your concern, but we are not heading back until we have ourselves a little swim. Is that clear?”

A look of bewilderment creeped onto the silver wolf’s face, which, after a small sigh, turned into a look of reluctant acceptance.

Although he was much more powerful than you, an elite fighter with many years of training and experience, to him, you were the one in charge. You were the one calling the shots. You, despite being so small that you were literally in the palm of his hand, were the one in control.

Kamui had that much faith in you, and you knew that. You would never take his devotion for granted, but given the many ways he showed his admiration, you knew that there were times when you had to voice your displeasure.

You decided that this was one of those times. Kamui had to swallow his pride and prove to his hero that he was subservient, and from that, you already knew what his response was going to be.

“If that is what you wish, my hero.”

“I’m happy to hear you say that.” You give the wolf a big smile, grateful for his servitude. “Now, place me inside your ear.”

Contempt with his hero’s approval, Kamui complied. As he did what he was told, his face was already back to its natural, stoic expression.

You grabbed on tight to a handful of the wolf’s fur, speaking softly into his ear:

“Thank you, Kamui. So... where are we off to?”

But unbeknownst to you he mentally kept going, "And besides now I don't have to worry about alone ever again....."

And even though he didn't verbally say anything during this time you did a sad expression form on his face which concerned you as you asked, "Hey Ashigara, is everything okay?"

"Huh? Y-Yeah everyting's fine." The beastman reassured you, while he let out a happy laugh. After doing so though you saw an embarrassed expression form on his face before he went on with, "But if we're still going to go see the Cherry Blossoms together then I had best put you somewhere safe. You know just so I don't lose you while I hike up the mountain path."

"Um okay. So where did you have in mind to put me?" You questioned, followed by titling you head to the side a bit.

Booming footsteps shook the ground, carrying a true force of power. Just as you looked behind you, a large red armored boot stomped into the ground. You were thrown onto the ground by the force and looked up to see a familiar sight.

It was the hell knight Marchosias, by his side was the child he protected also a giant.

"Our comrade was suppose to be here, but I don't see him in sight at all."

The wolf turned and swiveled his boot, nearly bumping you as he stepped away to look for you. You needed to get Marchosias's attention, but it would be difficult with how large the knight was now.

In the midst of your thoughts, a shadow loomed over you. Looking up, you saw the little boy was looking down at you curiously. Croatching down, the shadow darkened.

"Um hello! Could you bring me to Marchosias please!", you called up.

The boy looked surprised before slowly. Bringing his right hand down, the boy laid it in front of you. Slowly, you walked onto the palm and was able to fit in the center. The child stood up and used his other hand to support you. A smile graced his face as he carried you to Marchosias.

The child used his left hand to tug on his protector's right hand. The wolf looked down a bit surprised.

"Little one, what's wrong did something happen?"

The palm holding you was brought up so that you would be seen by Marchosias. The hell knight saw your small form and widened his eyes as he spotted you.

He......

1553322222222222222221.content:
You slowly open your eyes to find yourself shrunken on a sunny shore. There’s nothing near you except for what seems to be a giant blue platform. You didn’t realize it at first because of your shrunken size, but after getting closer to it, you see that it’s a sleek-looking surfboard. Whoever the owner is clearly cares for it a lot as you can practically see your own reflection in it.

Looking at the surfboard, you don’t even notice the gigantic shadow looming over you until a giant paw crashes down a few inches behind you.

You look up at the owner of the chubby paw to find Ganglie seemingly bending over you. The chubby boar is wearing nothing but a revealing speedo and you have a pretty good idea why. This is the beach that Ganglie frequents to practice his surfing skills and to show off his body to anyone looking.
Which means the surfboard you were looking at belongs to him.

You sigh. Out of all the transients that you’ve met in this world, Ganglie was definitely one of the least reliable. He was a slob, and tended to do as little work as possible in any situation. But, right now, he was your only choice.

And even before your paths were blocked off by Ganglie’s meaty legs, the trips to anyone else might take you forever. The sweltering heat on the beach combined with the tubby boar’s natural heat caused a concerning amount of sweat to form on his fur. And, in turn, a fetid miasma of Ganglie’s sweaty stench was forced onto your miniscule body. The musk attached itself to you and forced itself into your nostrils. It overwhelmed your senses; the only thing you could do was wriggle underneath Ganglie’s weight. You had no clue where you were but you would do anything to escape the fetid stench of dirt and sweat that was surrounding your body.
Above you, Ganglie felt an itch underneath his rump. Reaching back, the boar casually adjusts his speedo, momentarily releasing it from the dank depths of his musky crack. In this brief moment, you had managed to get stuck in the floral-pattern fabric of Ganglie’s speedoes. Ganglie moved his finger off of his speedoes and just like that, they were sent back in between his fat cheeks, along with your tiny form.
In one swift motion, you were forced into Ganglie’s stench-ridden butt crack and found yourself face to face with the transient’s tailhole. The giant pucker pulsated as if it knew you were there. The stench was dreadful and the sweat and dirt covered your entire body. Before you knew it...

15533222222222222222232223.title: Makara

choices: No, but he hasn't crushed you either
Yes, by the smallest of margins
155332222222222222222322231.content:
Hands buried in your head, you start to rise from your unintended slumber. You race your mind to think of what caused you to faint but the last thing you remembered was heading to the beach with some of your transients to take a break from all the battling that had occurred lately, but that didn't explain why you were completely flat on your back unconscious. As your vision starts to return, you find yourself in an endless desert with nothing but sand dunes to add some character to the landscape. Concentrating on your hearing and sense of smell, you can still smell the moist sand and hear the rolling waves of a beach - faintly, but they are there. As you begin to wonder why this dry desert still sounds and smells like the beach and whether you should stay put, hoping your transient friends help you, you get an answer to both questions.

Makara had just finished a quick dip in the sea, his scales sorely missed the gentle caress of saltwater. Despite that, his mind couldn't help but wonder where his summoner had escaped to, he certainly hoped he wasn't in any trouble! If that were the case, he certainly wouldn't feel fit to call himself a lifeguard. The gator mulled it over as he laid belly up on the surface of the water. He knew the summoner could handle himself if anything went awry but... "No, he's fine, I'm sure of it". Maybe some sunbathing while listening to the sounds of the ocean would help calm him? Yeah. Deciding this, Makara headed to shore, water dripping off off of him as he emerged from the water.

Quakes started to rumble around you, threatening to throw you to ground if you didn't yourself. The quakes did not weaken however, and only got stronger as time went on. Looking for answers you spot a colossal form on the horizon that only seemed to keep expanding as time went on. A blue and yellow blur. Kind of looked a little like... no, that wouldn't make sense. However, as the blurry mass started to clear and the pristine blue and yellow scales revealed themselves you had to accept it. You were still in the beach. Those quakes weren't quakes at all. And, the behemoth in front of you was one of your most trusted summons. Makara.

That could only mean one thing; you had shrunk. Your mind kept trying to process this as the titan continued to approach you, his features only becoming clearer as he did. His care free yet determined face, his small striped vest that couldn't contain his now vast stomach, even his swimwear which was several sizes too small. This was 100% your transient friend. Soon his large form stands practically above you, large lakes of water splashing down above you; had you have been less lucky you would have easily drowned in the presence of your lifeguard transient. The titan scans the beach for something, his gargantuan head moving around and ignoring you like one of the millions of grains of sand. You shout up to him, but all is in vain as he decides to continue with his journey, his single foot blocking any sort of view as he prepares to move on.

Grains of sand and salt water pelt the ground around you as the large foot approaches, only eclipsing more of the sky as seconds pass. At your size its difficult to tell excactly where the foot is going to land. Do you manage to evade the foot?
155332222222222222222322231.title: At the beach?

You find yourself shrunk amongst the many attractive characters of Tokyo Afterschool Summoners!
Here are some guidelines:
1. Male and female interaction is allowed, though male is much more encouraged.

2. Try not to kill the character too quickly and if you do, don't make it gorey.

3. I'm pretty much okay with everything, except for unbirth.

4. If I edit your chapter, it's probably either because of grammar issues or simply something I didn't want to see. Please don't be offended.

I will be awarding gift points for good adds

Other than that, GO WILD!!
